meanings.definition: To grind or strike the teeth together in anger or pain.
meanings.sent1: When he is angry, he gnashes his teeth loudly.
meanings.sent2: She gnashes her teeth when she is in pain.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character gnashes his teeth in frustration.
meanings.sent4: The gears of the old machine gnash together noisily.
meanings.sent5: The monster in the movie gnashes its teeth menacingly.

meanings.definition: To bite or chew on something with force.
meanings.sent1: The dog gnashes on the bone to break it apart.
meanings.sent2: He gnashes on the tough steak to chew it properly.
meanings.sent3: The toddler gnashes on the toy to explore its taste.
meanings.sent4: The squirrel gnashes on the nut to crack it open.
meanings.sent5: The horse gnashes on the hay with enthusiasm.
